definition: to measure roughly (with the hand, a stick, string etc)
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]

euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word
to measure

sentences.english: I am interested in meeting good people. I prefer quality over quantity.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢善良的人，我觉得质比量重要。

sentences.english: Q is for quality, quality matters more than quantity.
Thee carpenter singing his as he measures his plank or beam.
sentences.chinese: 木匠在歌唱着，一边比量着他的木板或梁木。

sentences.english: " This is called "knowledge of comprehension by inference.
To me, quality is more important than quantity.
sentences.chinese: 对我而言，质比量更重要。

sentences.english: For study, quality is more important than quantity.
sentences.chinese: 就学习而言，质要比量重要。

sentences.english: Quality is more important than quantity. One home run is much better than two doubles.
sentences.chinese: 品质比量重要，一支全垒打比两支二垒安打好许多。

sentences.english: There is a parabola correlation between the MOE and vascular bundle proportion.
sentences.chinese: 抗弯弹性模量与维管束比量有较高的抛物线关系。
